DataElement.preferredName: Barthel Index of Activities of Daily Living 7 1965 Version Ability to Use Stairs Score 2 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An observation of a person's ability to use stairs, using a 2 point scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Barthel Index of Activities of Daily Living Ability to Use Stairs Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A clinical assessment tool designed to measure functional independence and need for assistance in mobility, self-care, and activities of daily living._A question about an individual's ability to walk up and down stairs._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Barthel Index of Activities of Daily Living
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A clinical assessment tool designed to measure functional independence and need for assistance in mobility, self-care, and activities of daily living.

Concepts.longName: Barthel Index of Activities of Daily Living
Concepts.definition: A clinical assessment tool designed to measure functional independence and need for assistance in mobility, self-care, and activities of daily living.

Property.preferredDefinition: A question about an individual's ability to walk up and down stairs.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A question about an individual's ability to walk up and down stairs.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: Barthel Index:Barthel Index of Activities of Daily Living. Collin et al., 1988
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for DCI study in Rave. mc 2/5/17

ValueDomain.preferredName: Barthel Index 1965 Version Use of Stairs Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual can go up and down stairs independently of help from others.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual can go up and down stairs independently of help from others.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual needs verbal or physical help or a carrying aid to use stairs.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual needs verbal or physical help or a carrying aid to use stairs.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
